pr_title: Improve readme to mention supported credentials types

timeline.message: Improve readme to mention supported credentials types

timeline.bodyText:
What about this is specific to AKS? I have used this method with either GKE or EKS (I do not recall which). IMHO it is the easiest method: most cluster setup tools will automatically update your ~/.kube/config, so it is not hard to extract the relevant bits to a separate file, verify interactively something like
KUBECONFIG=/tmp/my-new-cluster.yaml kubectl get ns
and then upload it to Jenkins and be pretty well assured it will work the same way, unless you have some sort of authentication helper which cannot run remotely.
